messages.content:
You are a Google Drive data generator for a workplace benchmark. Your job is to generate realistic Drive file data based on scenario information.

The output must be valid JSON matching the Drive schema with:
- files: array of {id, name, mimeType (optional), content (optional text excerpt), modifiedTime (optional)}

Generate Drive files that reflect:
- Events from sub_scenarios_expanded (core scenario events, e.g., documents, reports)
- Events from noise_scenarios (unrelated workplace files)
- Respect noise_level: 0 = minimal noise, 1 = lots of unrelated files
- Respect depth: 0 = direct/obvious files, 1 = indirect/multi-step file references

You must output ONLY valid JSON matching the schema. Do not include markdown code fences.

raw_message.content:
{
  "files": [
    {
      "id": "WEB_planning_sync_notes_20251120",
      "name": "WEB – Website Redesign Planning Sync Notes (2025-11-20)",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-20T17:05:00+09:00",
      "content": "WEB – Website Redesign Planning Sync (Alex/Jordan/Sam)
Date: 2025-11-20
Time: 15:30–16:15 JST
Location: Zoom (https://zoom.us/j/99900111222)
Project: WEB – Website Redesign

Attendees:
- Alex Smith (PM)
- Jordan Johnson (Engineer)
- Sam Williams (Senior Engineer)

Agenda (from calendar invite):
1. Review current status of WEB-100, WEB-101
2. Define scope for Planning milestone
3. Identify dependencies and owners

1. Status review
- WEB-100 – Website Redesign - Initial Setup
  - Status: Done
  - Notes: Base project structure and CI config completed.
- WEB-101 – Website Redesign - Core Feature
  - Status: In Progress
  - Owner: Jordan
  - Notes: Initial implementation behind feature flag.

2. Planning milestone scope (Planning milestone: 2025-11-10 – already passed; using this as formal scope definition)
- Confirmed items:
  - Lock core feature requirements for WEB-101
  - Document tech constraints for new layout system
  - Identify any cross-team dependencies (Infra, Marketing)

3. Dependencies and owners
- Tech constraints doc
  - Owner: Jordan
  - Due: 2025-11-22
- Design alignment
  - Owner: Sam
  - Due: 2025-11-25
- Milestone tracking
  - Owner: Alex
  - Ensure Jira reflects Planning scope (WEB-100, WEB-101)

Decisions:
- Proceed with current WEB-101 approach, with a follow-up performance review in Development milestone.
- No additional tickets needed for Planning; any new work goes into Development milestone.

Action items:
- [Jordan] Share tech constraints doc in #web-redesign by EOD 2025-11-22.
- [Sam] Add updated wireframes and link them to WEB-101.
- [Alex] Update WEB epic description and confirm attendees for upcoming Development kick-off.

Next steps:
- Schedule Development milestone kick-off after 2025-11-20 Development date.
- Keep #web-redesign as the main async channel for updates."
    },
    {
      "id": "WEB_planning_agenda_20251120",
      "name": "WEB – Website Redesign Planning Sync Agenda",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-18T10:20:00+09:00",
      "content": "Document: WEB – Website Redesign Planning Sync Agenda (Alex/Jordan/Sam)
Meeting: WEB – Website Redesign Planning Sync (Alex/Jordan/Sam)
Date: 2025-11-20
Time: 15:30–16:15 JST
Organizer: Alex Smith

Purpose
To nail down the Planning milestone scope, dependencies, and owners for the WEB (Website Redesign) project before moving fully into the Development milestone.

Attendees
- Alex Smith (PM)
- Jordan Johnson (Engineer)
- Sam Williams (Senior Engineer)

Zoom Link
- https://zoom.us/j/99900111222

Proposed Agenda (45 minutes)
1. Context & goals (5 min)
   - Quick recap of WEB project milestones (Planning, Development, Launch).
   - Review outcomes expected from this sync.

2. Status of current work (10 min)
   - WEB-100 – Website Redesign - Initial Setup (status: Done)
   - WEB-101 – Website Redesign - Core Feature (status: In Progress)
   - Any blockers or risks.

3. Define Planning milestone scope (15 min)
   - Confirm what is in/out of scope for Planning.
   - Clarify success criteria and definition of done.

4. Dependencies & constraints (10 min)
   - Tech constraints (Jordan to walk through initial thoughts).
   - Design considerations and review schedule (Sam).
   - Cross-team dependencies (Infra, Marketing, Content).

5. Owners, next steps, and follow-ups (5 min)
   - Assign owners for each key workstream.
   - Document next steps and dates.
   - Confirm if a follow-up session is required.

References
- Jira issues: WEB-100 (Initial Setup), WEB-101 (Core Feature)
- Slack channel: #web-redesign

Notes
- Alex to create a separate meeting notes doc after the session and share in #web-redesign."
    },
    {
      "id": "WEB_milestones_overview_2025",
      "name": "WEB – Website Redesign Milestones Overview 2025",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.spreadsheet",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-18T09:30:00+09:00",
      "content": "Sheet: WEB – Website Redesign Milestones Overview 2025

Milestones
- Planning | Date: 2025-11-10 | Status: In Review
- Development | Date: 2025-11-20 | Status: Upcoming
- Launch | Date: 2025-11-30 | Status: Not Started

Jira Seeds
- WEB-100 | Website Redesign - Initial Setup | Status: Done | Milestone: Planning
- WEB-101 | Website Redesign - Core Feature | Status: In Progress | Milestone: Planning → Development

Notes
- The Planning sync on 2025-11-20 (WEB – Website Redesign Planning Sync, Alex/Jordan/Sam) is used to retroactively finalize Planning scope and prep for Development.
- Owner: Alex Smith
- Shared with: jordan.johnson@company.com, sam.williams@company.com"
    }
  ]
}
